content: Norway’s Otta River at Lendbreen ice patch where melting ice has revealed more than 1,000 artifacts dating around 300 - 1500 A.D., telling the story of a mountain pass that served as a vital corridor for travel…NOTE: An ice patch, unlike a glacier, does not move, thus the artifacts are not damaged by shifts in ice layers__no.0536, 2020. #Norway #Europe #discovery
